org.docheinstein.commons.utils.logger

Class DocLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.docheinstein.commons.utils.logger.DocLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LoggerCapable

    public class DocLogger
extends java.lang.Object
implements LoggerCapable
    Represents a logger associated with a tag (usually a class) that is able to print messages with different log levels.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DocLogger.LogLevel
      Level of logging.

        Creates a logger and uses the class name for build the logger's tag.

        Returns:
        a logger with a tag associated with the given class
        See Also:
        createForTag(String)

      • getTagForClass

        public static java.lang.String getTagForClass(java.lang.Class clazz)
        Returns a tag for the given class.

        This is actually created by making all upper case, separating the upper case characters with underscores.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to use for define the tag
        Returns:
        the tag associated with the given class

        public static void enableLoggingOnFiles(java.io.File folder,
                                        java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.String> fileNameSupplier,
                                        boolean flush)
        Enables logging on files.
        Parameters:
        folder - the folder where the logs files will be saved to
        fileNameSupplier - the supplier of the current log file name
        flush - whether the log file should be flushed after each write

      • disableLoggingOnFiles

        public static void disableLoggingOnFiles()
        Disables logging on files.

      • isLoggingOnFilesEnabled

        public static boolean isLoggingOnFilesEnabled()
        Returns whether the logging on files is enabled
        Returns:
        whether this logger should write to file

      • global

        public static DocLogger global()
        Returns the global logger that is not associated with any tag or class.

        The use of this logger is not encouraged since the information about the entity that prints the messages is lost.

        Returns:
        the application global logger
